Copying a Query

StarTeam allows you to create new queries quickly by copying an existing query and editing it. Using this feature saves time because you do not have to re-create the query conditions.

To copy a query:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Do one of the following:

    • Right-click a column header on the upper pane. Then select Queries from the context menu.

    • Select Filters > Queries from the component or context menu.

    The Queries dialog opens.

  4. Select the query to be copied from the list, and then click Copy. The Copy Query dialog opens.

  5. Enter the name for the new query in the Query Name text box.

  6. Do one of the following:

    • Select the Public check box to add this query to the project (and the server configuration), allowing anyone with the appropriate access rights to use it.

    • Clear the check box to make the query private – that is, available only to your user ID.

  7. Click OK. The query displays in the Query dialog.

  8. If this is a public query, you may want to set access rights for it. See Granting Access Rights at the Component Level and Granting Access Rights for Specific Filters and Queries.

  9. To change the conditions in the query, select it from the Query dialog, and click Edit. This action opens the Edit Query [xxx] dialog.

  10. Edit the appropriate nodes of the tree.

  11. Click Save. This action re-displays the Query dialog.

  12. Click Close.
